title: Configure UCODE run — ucConf
text: Configure UCODE run

title: Configure UCODE run — ucConf
code: ucConf(   general = ucConfGeneral(),   parameters = ucDefaultConfParameters(),   weights = ucDefaultConfWeights() )

title: Configure UCODE run — ucConf
text: general configuration control parameters retrieved ucConfGeneral. parameters data.frame row representing parameter configuration e.g. retrieved ucConfParameter. possible parameter names see ucSetPlaceholder weights Matrix weights e.g. retrieved ucDefaultConfWeights. Matix weights used calculating overall fitness. Row names = names fitness indicators set c("", "MAE", "MSE", "RMSE", "NRMSE", "PBIAS", "RSR", "rSD", "NSE", "mNSE", "rNSE", "d", "md", "rd", "cp", "r", "R2", "bR2", "KGE, "VE"). Column names = well names ("PW" = pumping well, observation wells named parameter setting). See example.

what: General settings in UCODE configuration — ucConfGeneral
title: General settings in UCODE configuration — ucConfGeneral
text: General settings UCODE configuration

title: General settings in UCODE configuration — ucConfGeneral
General settings in UCODE configuration — ucConfGeneral
text: gof.digits Number digits used goodness fit values. Default: 5 maxIter Maximum number parameter-estimation iterations allowed stopping

what: Create parameter for UCODE configuration — ucConfParameter
title: Create parameter for UCODE configuration — ucConfParameter
text: Create parameter UCODE configuration

title: Create parameter for UCODE configuration — ucConfParameter
code: ucConfParameter(   paramname,   startvalue = 1e+38,   lowerValue = -1e+38,   upperValue = 1e+38,   lowerConstraint = 0,   upperConstraint = 1,   constrain = "yes",   adjustable = "yes",   maxChange = 2,   perturbAmt = 0.5 )

title: Create parameter for UCODE configuration — ucConfParameter
text: paramname Parameter name (12 characters; case sensitive) - character string used template file equation derived parameter Derived_Parameters input block. parameter name needs unique can parameter name defined Derived_Parameter input block. possible parameter names see ucSetPlaceholder startvalue Starting parameter value. Default=huge real number. huge real number obtained computer used commonly 1e38. lowerValue Smallest reasonable value parameter. Default= -(Huge real number). absolute value, commonly -1e38. upperValue Largest reasonable value parameter. Default= +(Huge real number). Commonly +1e38. lowerConstraint Lower limit considered parameter values. Default (HS): 0 upperConstraint Upper limit considered parameter values. Default (HS): 1 constrain yes: constrain parameter values using LowerConstraint UpperConstraint. Default (HS): yes. adjustable yes: change value needed depending purpose UCODE_2005 run defined UCODE_Control_Data input file. : leave value parameter unchanged. Default (HS): "yes". maxChange Maximum fractional parameter change allowed parameter iterations. Default=2.0. perturbAmt Fractional amount parameter value perturb calculate sensitivity. Commonly 0.01 0.10. Default (HS): 0.5. See discussion Chapter 3.

title: Create parameter for UCODE configuration — ucConfParameter
text: data.frame containing argument values column names equalling function argument names

title: Create parameter for UCODE configuration — ucConfParameter
code: # Use rbind to create a data.frame containing parameter information as   # required by ucConf:   cpara <- rbind(     ucConfParameter(paramname = "HKR", startvalue = 2e-5,                      lowerConstraint = 1e-5, upperConstraint = 1e-1,                     maxChange = 1, perturbAmt = 0.5,                      constrain = "yes", adjustable = "yes"),     ucConfParameter(paramname = "HKZ", startvalue = 2e-7,                      lowerConstraint = 1e-7, upperConstraint = 1e-3,                     maxChange = 1, perturbAmt = 0.5,                     constrain = "yes", adjustable = "yes"))        # set this parameter setting in default UCODE configuration   ucConf(parameters = cpara) #> $general #> $general$gof.digits #> [1] 5 #>  #> $general$maxIter #> [1] 100 #>  #>  #> $parameters #>   paramname startvalue lowerValue upperValue lowerConstraint upperConstraint #> 1       HKR      2e-05     -1e+38      1e+38           1e-05           0.100 #> 2       HKZ      2e-07     -1e+38      1e+38           1e-07           0.001 #>   constrain adjustable maxChange perturbAmt #> 1       yes        yes         1        0.5 #> 2       yes        yes         1        0.5 #>  #> $weights #>      PW PD1 PD2 PS1 PS2 #> RMSE  1   1   1   1   1 #> NSE   1   1   1   1   1 #> mNSE  1   1   1   1   1 #>

what:
Prepare calibration of WTAQ-model by creation of needed input and control
files — ucPrepCalib
title:
Prepare calibration of WTAQ-model by creation of needed input and control
files — ucPrepCalib
text: input files needed run UCODE calibration WTAQ model created directory tdir. default (open.tdir = TRUE) directory opened Windows explorer. can use created batch file runParallelUCode.bat start UCODE calibration.

title:
Prepare calibration of WTAQ-model by creation of needed input and control
files — ucPrepCalib
code: ucPrepCalib(   wtaqConfiguration = wtDefaultConfiguration(),   uconf = ucConf(),   tdir = tempdir(),   open.tdir = TRUE,   wtaq = system.file("extdata", "wtaq.2.1.exe", package = "kwb.wtaq"),   ucode = system.file("extdata", "ucode_2005.exe", package = "kwb.wtaq") )

title:
Prepare calibration of WTAQ-model by creation of needed input and control
files — ucPrepCalib
text: wtaqConfiguration WTAQ configuration retrieved wtConfigure uconf UCode configuration retrieved ucConf tdir target directory input control files created. Default: temporary directory current R Session. Attention! temporary directory emptied R session finished! open.tdir TRUE, target directory opened Windows Explorer order allow inspecting created files wtaq full path WTAQ executable ucode full path UCODE executable

title:
Prepare calibration of WTAQ-model by creation of needed input and control
files — ucPrepCalib
code: # Define WTAQ configuration... # Here: just load the configuration of WTAQ's Sample problem 2 wtaqConfiguration <- kwb.wtaq::wtConfigurationExample2()    # Define parameters p <- rbind(   ucConfParameter(     "HKR",      startvalue = 2e-5,      lowerConstraint = 1e-5,      upperConstraint = 1e-1,     maxChange = 1,      perturbAmt = 0.5   ),   ucConfParameter(     "HKZ",      startvalue = 2e-7,      lowerConstraint = 1e-7,      upperConstraint = 1e-3,     maxChange = 1,      perturbAmt = 0.5   ) )      # Define weights # # The following weight matrix w gives a weight of 1 to the root mean square # error (RMSE) and the Nash-Sutcliffe-Efficiency (NSE) between simulated # and observed values at the pumping well ("PW") and to the NSE between # simulated and observed values at the observation well "PS1". # # well -> PW PS1 w <- matrix(c( 1,  1,  # RMSE  <- GOF               1,  1), # NSE            nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE,            dimnames = list(c("RMSE", "NSE"), c("PW", "PS1")))  # Create UCODE configuration uconf <- ucConf(general = ucConfGeneral(maxIter = 100),                parameters = p, weights = w)  # Create all input files needed to run the UCODE calibration of WTAQ # sample problem 2 tdir <- ucPrepCalib(wtaqConfiguration = wtaqConfiguration, uconf = uconf) #> *** Writing WTAQ arguments file /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//Rtmp5NjDGD/wtaq.args ... #> *** Writing GOF evaluation script /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//Rtmp5NjDGD/serialWtaqGof.R ... #> *** Writing batch file /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//Rtmp5NjDGD/runSerialWtaq.bat ... #> *** Writing batch file /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//Rtmp5NjDGD/runSerialWtaqDbg.bat ... #> *** Writing batch file /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//Rtmp5NjDGD/runParallelWtaq.bat ... #> *** Writing test input file ... #> *** Running test ... #> Error in shell(bfile): could not find function "shell"  # Run loop waiting for input files provided by UCODE (remove the comment # character in the following line!) #ucRunParallel(tdir, uconf = uconf)  # Now, run runParallelUCode.bat in the target directory...

what: Set placeholder in WTAQ parameter setting — ucSetPlaceholder
title: Set placeholder in WTAQ parameter setting — ucSetPlaceholder
text: Set placeholder parameter value WTAQ parameter setting

title: Set placeholder in WTAQ parameter setting — ucSetPlaceholder
Set placeholder in WTAQ parameter setting — ucSetPlaceholder
text: parname Parameter name. Must one aquifer parameters "bb", "hkr", "hkz", "ss", "sy" (description see wtConfigureAquifer) one drainage parameters "acc", "akk", "amm", "axmm" (description see wtConfigureDrainage; parameter "alpha" currently supported) one pumpwell parameters "qq", "rw", "rc", "zpd", "zpl", "sw" (description see wtConfigurePumpwell) one observation well parameters "r_i", "z1_i", "z2_i", "zp_i", "rp_i", "xll_i" (description see wtConfigureObservationWell) "" number observation well according list index "obswell" section parameter setting. wtaqConfiguration WTAQ parameter setting created means wtConfigure pchar character used first last character placeholder. Default: “@”

title: Set placeholder in WTAQ parameter setting — ucSetPlaceholder
text: Parameter setting parameter value replaced appropriate placeholder

title: Evaluate goodness of fit for WTAQ result — uwGofEval
Evaluate goodness of fit for WTAQ result — uwGofEval
text: res either character string representing full path WTAQ result plot file data.frame containing content WTAQ result plot file. logtimes TRUE, time steps supposed logarithmic, .e. assumed result plot file “matrix form”. gofs vector names fitness functions, evaluated gof. Default: c("", "MAE", "MSE", "RMSE", "NRMSE", "PBIAS", "RSR",    "rSD", "NSE", "mNSE", "rNSE", "d", "md", "rd", "cp", "r", "R2", "bR2",    "KGE", "VE") ... arguments passed gof() function, e.g. digits: decimal places used rounding goodness--fit indexes.
